name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole has a melting point of 100.0 degrees Celsius. The structural modifications in the compound (2Z)-2-(1,3-benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one can be considered as follows: (1) The benzodioxole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. (2) The methylene bridge can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. (3) The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. (4) The pyrimidine ring can contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
